summary: The Cooper Davis and Devin Norring Act mandates electronic communication and remote computing service providers to report to the Attorney General potential controlled substance violations. It defines terms like 'electronic communication service' and 'provider', outlines the types of violations requiring reporting (fentanyl, methamphetamine, counterfeit substances, and unauthorized prescription drug distribution), and details report content. The bill specifies the Attorney General's responsibilities, including data minimization and annual reporting. It also sets penalties for non-compliance and addresses privacy concerns. Exemptions are provided for broadband internet access and text messaging services. The act also includes conforming amendments to other related acts.
